section.name: Introduction
section.p: Packet Spy is a java library that provides a mechanism for network packet capture. The library supports developers who wish to write cross platform network packet capture programs.

Packet Spy uses the libpcap library under *nix style systems and WinPCap library on Windows systems. Packet Spy also provides a basic protocol decosing layer for popular protocols such as; Ethernet2 (IEEE 802.3), IPv4, ICMP, IGMP, TCP and UDP.

Packet Spy was developed as part of the Hive research project. Initially Hive considered using the exisiting java packet capture libraries. The existing libraries had limitations that prohibitted their use in long running packet capture applications. This limitation was acceptable in the context of the research Hive was undertaking and as a result Packet Spy was developed. No code from the existing libraries was incorporated into Packet Spy but many of the ideas and approaches can be directly credited to the existing libraries.
